website_summaries.verdict: Love Belgian waffles but ready to try chaffles? This machine has the features you need to make the treat keto-friendly.
pros: Can make 2 chaffles at once, Belgian-waffle style
Has non-stick plates and a variable browning control
cons: Take caution when using it, as the exterior gets very hot

customer_reviews.title: Uneven bake, toasty and soggy - not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The heating element caused an uneven bake of the waffle (see ring pattern in the picture) so waffle was partly over cooked and partly undercooked. It also stuck to the plate (in the picture, it’s on the top one) and dribbles around the sides are hard to clean (lots of small grooves). I do not recommend and have contacted the manufacturer with feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hoff

customer_reviews.title: This waffle iron was a hassle.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this waffle iron but I threw mine in the trash this morning. It heats very unevenly. The waffles would have a very dark ring through them yet the edges would barely be cooked. The picture attached to this product is how my waffles have turned out since day one. If there was the slightest overflow in the area between the handle and the grid, I would have to use a toothpick to get the cooked batter out. Overall, extremely disappointed. I would not waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: Lluau

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great item but I did have issues with the lock it seems to be shut tightly which could be a problem when your trying to get your waffle out before burning. Made awesome cinnamon roll waffles with it
customer_reviews.author: Shardai

customer_reviews.title: It's Waffle Time!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect waffles! Crispy on the outside, soft and slightly chewy in the middle. Beautiful browning, except on the very edge. Very simple and easy to use. The only drawback is that cleaning is a bit of a pain, but I expect that comes with the territory. The included instructions are spot on. A bit of nonstick spray, ~1/3c of batter, ~4-5m until it stops steaming, and out comes a beautiful square of goodness. All in all, especially given the inexpensive price, this is a fantastic value. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Adam MachanicTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Received used product?
customer_reviews.text: I received Hamilton Beach Belgian Waffle Maker 26009 today and upon inspection found scuff marks and the plastic front opening is a bit warped. Also, as other reviewers mentioned it’s flimsy. I’ll spend a bit more for a unit with removable plates for easy cleanup. Glad Amazon has a good return and customer service department.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this waffle maker! I bought it so that I can host a waffle bar for Thanksgiving with my parents, two brothers and their families. Everyone loved it! You have to be careful to not put a lot of mix because it does rise but other than that, it worked great and fast! It has a green light that turns on when the waffle is ready so it is easy to use and hard to burn the waffle. They loved it so much that I bought each their own waffle maker for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Smalllls

customer_reviews.title: If i could i would give it zero stars
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this, used it twice worked fine and then the third time I went to use it a little over a month of owning it, it wouldn't heat up. Both lights would light up instantly and it wouldn't do anything. I contacted Hamilton Beach about it and they offered to replace it which was nice of them but they wanted me to pay half the price of the item to have them ship out a new one! Ridiculous. A warranty means if something stops working with normal use it will be replaced. That should include shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Tara & Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Booooooooooooo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than 11 months ago and have used it according to instructions 2-3 times a month. It is already dead. It just flat out quit in the middle of Saturday morning breakfast. Do not buy unless you enjoy wasting your money semi-annually on waffle irons.
customer_reviews.author: eugenesavoy

customer_reviews.title: Great For Big Families
customer_reviews.text: I have six kids. Who all love having waffles for dinner. Well, making them was an impossible task unless I wanted to be in the kitchen for hours. This product, however, solved all that. I can make enough fast enough to feed all 9 of us (me, hubby, six kids and the nanny) and even have some left over to heat up for snacks the next day. I've been through about 5 different waffle makers. This is the only one that made the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bargain waffle maker. For the price it has a lot of great features and is a great price. The build quality is quite nice. I use it almost every weekend and am going on 2 years of usage without having any issues. The temperature/browning control works very well especially since I like my waffles a little bit crispy. I do wish there was not as much plastic on this device, but for the price I guess I can't complain too much. If this one ever fails I will hopefully buy another Hamilton Beach that has a bit less plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: This was the best $20 I've spent
customer_reviews.text: This was the best $20 I've spent. Next to my Keurig, this is the 2nd most used appliance in my kitchen. In fact, since I've bought it, I used it about 12 out of the 14 days that I had it. Including the preparation time, I now can make delicious waffles under 10 minutes. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a waffle maker!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: First time use went smoothe until the handle broke. Usually, Hamilton Beach products never let me down, but you get what you pay for with this waffle maker. Sending this back Asap and going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Queen B

customer_reviews.title: Nice reliable easy cleanup waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I've been making homemade waffles for over 20 years. I needed a new one. This one heats up in about 4 minutes initially and cooks waffles in about 2 minutes and one batch after another. I can set my timer for 2 minutes each batch (1/2 cup batter per square) and they are done right each time. No need to spray or put any shortening already non-stick. I have used for several months. No issues with sticking and easy damp cloth cleanup. Not super deep Belgian waffles, but somewhere in between which I like. Very nice waffle maker and reliable so far.
customer_reviews.author: outlander22

customer_reviews.title: Uneven cooking
customer_reviews.text: This product takes a long time to come to cooking temperature and a full 10 minutes to cook each waffle, and then takes way too long to completely cool down to clean or put away. The top heating element does not get hot enough, resulting in a cooked bottom side and uncooked top side. I have tried different waffle recipes and varied the slide bar temp control and have never had an estheticallly pleasing end result to serve family or friends. I'll probably try again and spend a little more, assuming you probably get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Net

customer_reviews.title: Chaffle goodness!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron works great, makes the perfect size for chaffle sandwich on Keto diet. You can cook both pieces at once for quicker results, one cycle and sandwich is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I opened this just in time to make my mother's birthday brunch to find the base was broken. If I didn't need it that day I would have exchanged it. It works, it is just wobbly. For the negatives: the opening lever is hot to the touch and there is no noise to signal that the waffle is cooked. My fault, I should have read more carefully. On the positive side: it makes a terrific waffle, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I also love the small size of the waffle. If they redesign so that the opening lever isn't hot to touch I would recommend this product, otherwise no.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this waffle maker to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waffle iron a few months ago. I've tried about 6 completely different waffle recipes in it with different ingredients and it still sticks! I have not once been able to pull out waffles that didn't stick and/or were not fully cooked. I waited till the green light indicator said "ready" each time, however, it always left me with sticky soggy waffles. After about the 3rd or 4th attempt I decided it wasn't the recipes it was the waffle maker. And yes, I used a spray oil to coat before cooking. I would not recommend this waffle maker to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Waffle Iron
customer_reviews.text: Great waffle maker, and it's easy to clean and store. We lightly coat it with canola oil using a heat resistant bbq silicone brush: we never have an issue with sticking. We especially love the small size for camping and organizing/storage. We also don't like a ton of appliances on our counters. We didn't want a heavy, bulky iron either, but then it's just the two of us. This works fast also. If we have guests we'd keep warm in the oven as we make more.
customer_reviews.author: HJR

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Just looking for a waffle iron that actually cooks a waffle like the picture advertises. I had a Hamilton Beach waffle/pancake maker with removable plates from over 20 years ago, which I gave my brother because he needed one. Well, so sorry I did, as we have not been able to find one that cooks as well as it did. This waffle iron cooks them very uneven and it took over 30 minutes to cook two, as it takes a long time to reheat to cook the next one. Wouldn't recommend this waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: UOdux

customer_reviews.title: Broke with 1st lift of the handle
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this waffle maker. I had watched a great review of it on YouTube. However mine came defective. I plugged it in and attempted to lift by the handle and it popped right off spring and all. Shame Hamilton Beach. Return for refund. Anybody that can recommend a good waffle iron? I bought the Cuisinart first and it came broken also. I really want a waffle maker but I'm bout to give up🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: JustBeingHonest

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a waffle maker or waffle iron. I've had this just a few days and all ready have used it three times. I've made traditional waffles (mix, have the heat just slightly right to center, takes 6 minutes) and I've made hashbrowns on them (7min, med-high heat). It does have a three prong plug-in, that maybe a challenge for some, but otherwise a pretty slender machine that wipes clean. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Eiden

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well but unevenly
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat disappointed in this as I had been waiting to get a new waffle iron that was big enough to make waffles for more than one person at a time. It cooks unevenly and sometimes the waffles are not quite done around the edges. It also has no other selection other than ON.....I prefer my cheaper and very old round waffle maker that I can preset the temp and know they come out done and perfect every time. Back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.author: Housekateer

customer_reviews.title: Rather disappointing
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be no real temp control, things came out just as well done on the low setting as on the medium or high. The plastic casing over the hinge has a large crack in it. Overall it worked for what we needed, but I know it will need to be replaced within a year, if I get that long from it
customer_reviews.author: Mae R

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for a few weeks and thought it was working well until a smell began to come from the device. Instead of seeping the butter/oil off the waffle maker, it apparently collected in the machine. I unscrewed the base and cleaned out the device but the smell was rotten and would not come out. The return policy is only for a month and was now past the chance to return it. I am disappointed this is not better constructed and am now trying to find another one. A terrible waste of money. I expected better of such a well known company.
customer_reviews.author: AlexZarate

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle iron for a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron is great! It is compact, easy to store and easy to clean. The waffles have deep holes for maximum crispy surface area, while the inside of the waffle stays soft and moist. As compared to my previous waffle iron, this one cooks faster and the temperature control dial offers more flexibility. My only complaint is that while in use, the metallic part of the waffle iron gets very hot and the black plastic base gets pretty hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Keto chaffels non-stick
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try the Keto Chaffels that I heard about. This "no stick" waffle iron produced the egg and cheese chaffels efficiently and cleaniy. I enjoyed using it. Thanks for being a good product and good seller.
customer_reviews.author: nancy m

customer_reviews.title: Okay even with a broken lid clip
customer_reviews.text: It was great the first 30 days then the clip to keep the lid tight broke off. It snapped off while I using it so I can’t blame it on my kids. There isn’t a replacement part for the clip. We’ve been using it for months without the clip and it’s okay. It’s still a pretty good little machine. My ratings are based on use after several months with the clip broken. Since we make waffles several times a week we will replace this with a higher quality maker.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: For all the Dads/Moms looking for a waffle maker because you wanna create memories for your child, this one fits the bill. Not only is it cheap, the waffles come out easily and tastes pretty good. I make sure to wake up extra early to make a waffle and eggs/grits for my boys a couple times a week so hopefully they can remember fond memories of “hanging out with dad during breakfast.” One tip, always spray upper and lower grills with a shot of Pam.
customer_reviews.author: CKrup

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The item appears easy to use at first however if you wait for the signal to get your waffle it will burn your waffle. Additionally no matter what nonstick you use or lack of the waffles stick to the waffle iron. It is incredible difficult to clean as well. Even using hot water to steam the burned remnants off doesn’t work. Additionally i cannot explain why but my stomach hurts after I eat a waffle from this device. I use the same mix when I make pancakes and do not experience the same issue. I have tried everything to clean it and remedy this issue. *****Do not buy*****
customer_reviews.author: john p mcminimee

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the waffle iron several times, hoping that I would like it better each time I used it, but I don’t. It heats inconsistently, the middle section of the waffle is nice and golden, but the outside edges are barely cooked, it’s really a pain to properly clean and you have to be careful opening the latch as sometimes steam builds up there and you’ll get burned trying to open it. If I still had the box I’d return it.
customer_reviews.author: JoyH

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used this waffle maker a piece of the bottom broke off when I set it down. I glued it back because I really wanted a waffle maker. However, when I used it a week later the other side broke! Since I used it and discarded the packaging I figure I cannot return it. I am extremely dissatisfied and disappointed! I will have to purchase a new one and it will NOT be a HAMILTON BEACH 26009. Series A4991DA! Or any other product you make!
customer_reviews.author: Godiva

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY. Using for Keto. Love it. Better then the singles.
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought a single Nostaligia maker and it took 6 minutes per Chaffle. This cuts the cook time down to 2.5 minutes per 2 chaffles! Very happy. I have mine set to half temp. I'd buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MrsPicky

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: A perfectly adequate waffle maker if you don't see the necessity of paying big bucks for an appliance. Excellent value. Gets good and hot if you like your waffles fluffy on the inside, crisp on the outside. Seems to cook evenly. Not much to review about it, as it's quite basic. I like to make a big batch and freeze them up for toaster waffles. Perfect for this.
customer_reviews.author: M. SpaldingTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this waffle maker at all cost! It is the biggest piece of junk I have ever owned - the waffles were done on the bottom but never would cook on the top. The only positive thing I have to say about it is that I did like the compact design, I just wish it would have worked and given me the nice, brown, fluffy waffles that were shown on the box.
customer_reviews.author: lonestar

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst product I have ever bought😡🤬 And this is after I cleaned it ...it was stuck to the top surface and the bottom surface that’s happened twice... I sprayed it was cooking oil Crisco the second time and it was just as bad as the first time😡
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Cooks unevenly
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I expected too much from a thirty dollar waffle maker but this thing is terrible. Sure, it does successfully make waffles, but they’re cooked unevenly to the point that part of the waffle is burnt and part of it is still raw. The timer to tell you if the waffle is done very inconsistent. You basically have just open it up and check every few minutes. I’ve used mine three time now and I’m going to put it in the trash and buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle iron for feeding everyone at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my sister and her family of four to replace her dual, rotating round waffle iron. She loves it better than the other style as it doesn't require you to babysit the iron and she can make four waffles at once. Her new thing is to pop in diced hash browns and crack an egg over them and close it up. Comes out cooked thoroughly and crispy hash browns so its got more uses than just the waffle
customer_reviews.author: Nini

customer_reviews.title: Hot!
customer_reviews.text: I love the feature that it stands up on its side... takes up less space. BUT, when you're cooking and need to open it to take out the finished waffles, the handle is SO hot!! It builds up steam there and I slightly burn myself every time I open it. I probably wouldn't have bought this if I would have known, but I guess I'm just going to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: BLK

customer_reviews.title: NOT good
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good waffle iron. It only has one heat setting, the trays don’t come out, it’s big, heavy and awkward. It takes up a lot of room. The food doesn’t get very brown because it doesn’t get hot enough. I ordered it in a hurry and now I’m mad I didn’t research it better.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions perfectly. However, every batch of waffles I made stuck to the griddle. Ridiculous. No one has time for that mess. I missed the return window so off to donations it goes. Total waste, don't bother buying.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine44

customer_reviews.title: It irons waffles
customer_reviews.text: The waffle iron is a waffle iron, strictly speaking it irons waffles. Fact of the matter is it does it's job and does it well. At that point it depends on the chef. Only skepticism is the cord is a mite short. It has a clip like lock when you close it but I suspect that's more useful to hold it together while storing and relocating, not so much while cooking; the waffle takes the clip in fight, pops up. Its more amusing than anything honestly, no harm done, no trouble or struggle. I'm happy. (For the Engineers: the waffles are not perfectly square, they are 4x5 sad to say)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy and makes amazing waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! Easy to use and makes great waffles. This product unlike many of the others on the market makes two smaller waffles so you do not need to make the huge Belgian waffles like in hotels and restaurants, 2 of these is perfect for breakfast. But also quick so if you have a bigger appetite you can quickly make another batch. Irons are non stick so cleaning is very easy and no issues with changing batters between batches because you don’t really need to clean any residue off.
customer_reviews.author: Green102018

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Our 45 year old waffle maker finally died, so bought this one. I put shortening on it the first time as suggested, but haven't needed it since. I haven't noticed any difference between the lowest temp and the highest so far ;-) Makes great waffles quickly. Yum!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret N

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK AFTER 3 USES...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas so he would stop taking mine back to college. Unfortunately for us he went back to school end of January used product 3x and it stopped working.... return time ended wasted money for 3 uses...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Danger - burn hazard
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the worst kitchen appliance I ever purchased. Not only are the waffle plates undersized, but the waffles (regardless of time and/or temperature) either come out soggy or soggy and burned. The added plus is that the cover lock is configured so that you must be real careful or you will burn yourself when you open up the waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Bluez

customer_reviews.title: Don't Burn Your Hands!! Ouch
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of this waffle maker works fine. HOWEVER, the outside (lid, sides) gets as hot as fire and remains hot while it it cools for at least an hour. The lid is metal, however it's very unassuming that it will be burning hot. I have several burns on my hands from using it. So make the waffles, but be careful of the lid and burning yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Teske

customer_reviews.title: It's crap
customer_reviews.text: This piece of garbage stick made my waffles stick horribly, even after useing a veggie oil spray. The only reason why I gave a 4 star rating was for the durability after I threw it outside and it hit the concrete and the ease of use was me throwing it !!! Spend the extra few bucks for a real waffle maker like I'm going to. This item belongs in a dollar store....
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I tried it this morning to make waffle cakes (pancake batter) for my husband and they turned out great. I used it to make scramb
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I saw a post on Facebook about using a waffle maker for other than waffles. I tried it this morning to make waffle cakes (pancake batter) for my husband and they turned out great. I used it to make scrambled eggs too after he had the waffle cakes but I used too many eggs so when it started fluffing up when cooking it almost popped it open. If I hadn't released the latch when I did it I think it would have popped the top open. But the eggs turned out good too. My husband was happy. I want to try hash browns next!
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Willis

customer_reviews.title: Is this worth your money?
customer_reviews.text: I think this thing is good.. Can't be certain though because it never gets used. My wife insisted on having one but we all know what happens with machines like this. Do you really need this? Really? If so,then it made perfectly golden brown and crunchy waffles the 2 times we've used it!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cooked one waffle and it broke and refused to heat ten minutes later. I was forced to return it for a full refund. Disappointed was putting it mildly. The griddle does not remove for easy cleaning.... that sucks too! Get yourself something else, that works and that removes to clean in a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday and I was so excited to try it, the product is very easy to use. I did not like the fact that the cord was so short, but whatever, I could live with that. This product says that it is non stick, that is wrong. I used a stick of butter and spread it everywhere but my pancakes got stuck to the waffle maker and then dried after I realized they were burning. Took me an hour to clean it up. Would not buy again and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anandzo

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and clean i love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this waffle maker although I've never used one its gonna take me some time to get it right temperature wise for the perfect waffles as well as right amount of batter to put in. I used it the very night I first got it and will use it again soon in another day or so. Practice makes perfect lol no more buying frozen waffles from the store for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets SUPER hot. Able to make a big batch in ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets SUPER hot. Able to make a big batch in a small amount of time despite only having 2 plates. Plates are not removable so kind of a pain to clean, but don't use often enough to justify a more expensive version.
customer_reviews.author: Moment2shine

customer_reviews.title: Alittle wiped down with oil before heated and my waffles came out perfect from the very first one to the last
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I am so impressed with this little machine. Alittle wiped down with oil before heated and my waffles came out perfect from the very first one to the last!!! I used Krusteaz Belgian Waffle mix, 1/3 cup each side. We travel a lot in the RV so I made my decision on its size. It is big enough to feed the 3 of us but small enough to not use up much space. BIG bang for your buck!!
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This makes excellent waffles. Surprisingly, they do come out slightly crispy on the edges as though they've been fried. They cook up in no time and 4 waffles should feed 2 adults. Each waffle is about the size of a piece of bread. Also, I couldn't ue the recommended 1/3 cup of batter as it overflowed when I closed the lid. The only real complaint is that I have to use nonstick spray or I have a little trouble getting them out. Also, if you get batter anywhere but on the metal plates then you've got a little scrubbing to do. Overall, I am happy withat my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Solid Machinery
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this waffle maker. It's extremely simple to use; essentially as close to plug-n-play as it gets. Cleaning was also not much of a problem. Fairly standard I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Mars

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that the lid allows for grilling thicker ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the lid allows for grilling thicker sandwiches, etc. I especially like being able to place food on the grill while it lays flat, then tilt it so that the fat drains away. My only complaint might be that the grill is a bit small. The two I had before (which I passed on to other family members) had larger grilling areas, which I miss. Other than that, I am perfectly satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LoveSiouxCityTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It makes waffles
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had a power switch so I could plug it in without it sparking the outlet. I'm sure it is horrible for the receptacle. The unit works perfectly though. Another problem that is not a deal-breaker is that condensation forms inside the unit while it is cooling down so when you close it and lift it by the handle liquid water drips out. Haven't been electrocuted yet but time will tell. Can't beat it for the $16 I paid open box.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waffle iron because I wanted to be able to reheat leftover waffles in my toaster and because it has gotten so many positive reviews. From the first use, I noticed that the waffles are burned where the heating element is. There's no way to adjust the temperature, so you are stuck with partly-burned waffles every time. I have tried to overcome this issue by removing the waffles before the "ready" light comes on, because the waffles are fully cooked about 30 - 60 seconds before the light comes on, but the burned ring is still there. I am not at all happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about 5x so far. It cooks well and evenly from what I've experienced. The only thing I don't care for is the cleaning but I knew the plates were not removable before I bought it. Just take a few min and wipe down each plate. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good, but do you ever eat only 2 waffles?
customer_reviews.text: This works beautifully, but unless you EVER eat only two waffles, the only reason to buy this model is because you have VERY limited space for storing kitchen gadgets. I typically cook four waffles, and this gadget unnecessarily prolongs that process by forcing me to do it in two batches.
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Heyser

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good product for the price. The waffles come out great and it's easy to use. The only down side is I've burned myself a few times. The metal of course gets extremely hot, as expected. The problem is the plastic parts that you actually should touch instead are a bit small (I do have fairly large hands to be fair) causing me to accidentally touch the metal at times. The plastic actually gets hotter than you'd expect too, but won't burn you immediately. If you use pot holders or something, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: This was my second waffle iron of this type. I liked it so much I ordered same one again when the original one got too old. The waffle iron is simple and inexpensive and works fine. However this time the black plastic piece in the front of the waffle iron broke off when I first used it. I could still operate the waffle iron. I returned the waffle iron and Amazon promptly replaced it. All else worked as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Inexpensive Little Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong. Works perfectly. I've been on a waffle making kick. Breakfast waffles and savory waffles. This little appliance works just perfectly. Not sure how long it will last, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey117

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Broken piece of bottom inside box. Doesn't sit still when using it wobbles but otherwise I like
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love me some square waffles
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with a square waffle maker, so I wanted to keep that tradition going. Got this to replace my Foreman grill that had waffle plates to switch out. This thing is great, but I'd allow longer than when the light comes on to let it heat up.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Shock

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me, I'm live alone. Only 1 to cook for. Larger irons make way too many waffles to eat at one sitting. And they don't taste the same microwave reheated. Easy release of cooked waffle; easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Nanea

customer_reviews.title: Burnt to Extra burnt
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this waffle iron at all. Even the lowest setting makes the waffels burn. Waffels are not meant to be that crispy. An what's the point in having a minimum to maximum switch if all it does is go from burnt to Extra burnt. The exterior gets way too hot when it shouldn't that I've burnt myself on it just trying to open it while in use. :( Not happy. Keep shopping..
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Benedetti

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice little waffle maker. It took me a few tries to get the amount right so I don’t overflow the batter. Lol. 4 minutes seems to be about right for cooking at medium temperature.
customer_reviews.author: sjones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker broke after 7 months. When I called Hamilton Beach they were willing to replace it, but wanted me to pay almost $12 in shipping, which is half the price of the cost of a new one. I will buy a different brand instead. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Heather N. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This Waffle iron makes perfect waffles every time.. I have tried experimenting with Waffle ironing different foods but it does make great waffles
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes terrible waffles
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes terrible waffles - totally unevenly cooked. The heating coil is a small fraction of the overly large cooking surface. Do not buy. I’m busy trying to figure out how to return it after just one use, but I’ll probably end up eating the cost because I think we already threw the box away.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work and is cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work. Wouldn’t heat up, stayed ice cold. The “ready” light stayed on the whole time. Don’t bother purchasing. Even if it did work, the item felt cheap and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Rastatam

customer_reviews.title: good for quick use, but make sure you set a timer.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great stuff, but the plates don't remove, so cleaning is a nasty mess. And there is no temp or timer on the system. The light process is only a steam sensor. When it stop steaming it's done. But sometimes it's about 2 mins too early.
customer_reviews.author: John smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice waffle maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Heats quickly and has an adjustable temperature. Cooked waffles perfectly the first time. Do be mindful to not overfill it with batter, or it will squish out, but otherwise great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The metal exterior of the waffle maker gets very hot
customer_reviews.text: It works great but the outside casing gets hot enough to burn you. You need to use a hot pad to touch the hot waffle maker or else make sure you only touch the plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky J

customer_reviews.title: Works good I use it on my off days
customer_reviews.text: Works good I use it on my off days, i love waffles and was tired of buying the processed ego waffles. If u love homemade waffles I recommend you buy. The griddle plates does not come off, you would have to wash the whole waffle maker which its not difficult just watch out for the cord. 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Brown

customer_reviews.title: Small and won't cook
customer_reviews.text: Too small and we had ours set at max and it still didn't get the waffles done enough. Wish I would've known before we used it so I could've returned it. Now I'm out money and stuck with something I dont want.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Its confusing with the temp dial instead of turning it on and it just going to a regular temp.. But i mean i guess it doesnt matter wd made eggs in it which is easy also waffles. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stac

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: We need a replacement for our previous waffle maker that finally gave out on us. I was looking for something small to store in our travel trailer. This one works for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Iggynw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for waffle cinnamon rolls!
customer_reviews.text: We use our waffle maker for so much more than waffles. I have a family of 5 and when I feel lazy, I take a pack of cinnamon rolls and in literal minutes, I have almost the whole family fed. Awesome maker!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: grates are easy to clean Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: price, attractive exterior, stores upright, the fact that it makes 4 waffles at once; grates are easy to clean Cons: if you overfill it, beware - you will have batter everywhere and it will be hard to clean off any surface other than the nonstick grates themselves. The amount of batter recommended by instruction may not be correct - I had to guess the correct amount. It was closer to 1/2 cup than to recommended 1/3 cup. Waffles not as thick as I'd like but I suppose for that you need a "flip" waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: chilanzar

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffles Anyone ?
customer_reviews.text: Used once...so far so good ! As in any appliance...practice makes perfect. The waffles were delish! Love the Belgium grates and the storage compactness.
customer_reviews.author: LKK

customer_reviews.title: Was great, at first . . .
customer_reviews.text: I loved this waffle maker at first, especially because it makes 4 at a time. However, after having it for 4 months, using it about once a week, the closure latch broke off. Now it won't cook properly because as the batter cooks, it pushes the waffle iron open. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Donley

customer_reviews.title: Use it alot!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy and fast waffle making! Always remember to spray the maker before adding waffle mix. You wont have any problems :)
customer_reviews.author: Cianne

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this waffle maker once. I see us using this at least once a week. The waffles turned out great and were a hit. The first 2 waffles did cook kind of uneven, but were still tasty. I find recipes online to try for waffles and pancakes, they taste so much better than the boxed stuff (only good if you like cardboard flavored rocks). I'm convinced that the recipe is just as important as the tool to make it. I tried this recipe and everything turned out wonderful.  (Hint: Whisk those eggs till you feel like you need a new arm)
customer_reviews.author: MomAsaur

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: The only downside being that there is no light indicating when the waffle is done as my old waffle maker had. If you pay attention and time it right, it's not a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: Racheljo

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used but a handful of times and the front latch popped off.....
customer_reviews.text: I've used this just a handful of times - the front latch that actually closes the unit just popped off. not impressed. Do not purchase unless you pay extra for the extended warranty plans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose but I kind of wish there was maybe a timer or some way to know that it’s done instead of opening it and possibly ruining the waffle. But overall nice and big and looks good in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Howard

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: For only $19.80, this would make a great gift for a single person. Also great as a Christmas stocking stuffer. It's well made and doesn't look or feel flimsy. However, it gets very hot and has to be handled carefully. There are lots of Belgian waffle recipes online, so it will be fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie C.

customer_reviews.title: best waffle maker for the price
customer_reviews.text: We had the same product for about ten years until the kids dropped it on the floor and it broke, we just bought the same product as it is the best waffle maker we've ever had. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Belgian Waffle Iron
customer_reviews.text: Being single, this is the perfect size waffle iron for me. Had a much larger iron when I was raising children. I like that it has Stainless Steel nonstick grids and preheat and on Lights. And you can choose what shade and crispy level you would like. And it is easy to store. I will definitely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Karolkaye

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older model
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to see that Hamilton Beaxh was still selling this model. Loved my old one and was bummed when it stopped working. The temperature on the new one is a tad touchy but still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good not the best
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, fits in the toaster after freezing. We use krusties pancake/ waffle recipe and they turn out crispy and delicious. Cleaning is a little difficult but manageable. I use bristle brush with very little soap and put waffle maker on its side over the sink and rinse it sideways with a squirt bottle making sure water doesn’t get into the electrical housing
customer_reviews.author: Schooley

customer_reviews.title: WORKS VERY WELL!  WAFFLES JUST FALL RIGHT OUT.
customer_reviews.text: This is working out great and churning out some delicious waffles! The children like that it has a little green light that shows you when the waffle is done. I like that I can pour running water over the top of it (when it is UNPLUGGED - of course), and it cleans off very well. I noticed that the directions specify that you do not need to spray it with non-stick spray unless you are using a lot of sugar in your waffle recipe. It is nice not to have to use the extra spray and have that weird spray coating that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: HAPPYMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Small Flaws, Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: It works great, not taking too long to heat up and mak s the waffles fast. And being able to make a whole batch at once saves so much time. Feels well put together, but there's two problems. The trays don't come off so you have to wash the whole unit, which with the rivets can be a pain. And there's no power switch, so you have to plug it in and unplug it whenever you're using it. Not a terrible problem, just needed to be stated I think.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to make 4 waffles at once (for my family of 5). This works just fine. My only complaint is that I wish the grids came out for easier cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this waffle maker! Being able to make 4 waffles at a time to feed my hungry family Saturday mornings is a huge time saver for me. I make my own waffle batter and it comes out perfectly golden, crisp and delicious! This is my second time buying this exact model because we used the other one so much it died. Thank God for Amazon because I couldn't find a store carrying this one again. We were without Waffles for about 2 months. So glad I was able to fine this on Amazon. Excellent buy!! Absolutely love this waffle maker!! I recommend it to any family!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gluten free waffles
customer_reviews.text: We've been using it to make gluten free waffles and boy does this thing work well. It's always a fine balance between getting gluten free mixes nice and crispy on the outside while still getting the inside fully cooked. After a few test waffles we found that just a hair back from the highest setting produces the best results. The waffles come out light, fluffy and goldenly delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Belgian Waffle Maker (26009) ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of use, simplicity of temperature control. We like our waffles crunchy, even with whole grain batters, it does a great job. I have managed to burn myself a couple of times through my own inattention. Plenty of product warnings concerning it, so I was adequately warned. That said, my husband has made several batches of waffles without any mishaps. He loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 2-Slice Non-Stick Belgian Waffle Maker with Browning Control, Indicator Lights, Compact Design, Premium Stainless Steel (26009)
product_meta.description: Size:2-SliceMake weekends special with hot, tasty waffles made in the Hamilton Beach Belgian style waffle maker. Just wait for the ready light to come on, and then add the batter. In 4 to 5 minutes, you’ll have two delicious waffles hot and ready to serve.
feature_bullets: Easy to use, easy to clean: This waffle iron features nonstick Belgian style grids that make two 1. 1" deep waffles - 4. 07" x 4. 92" each"
Versatile and delicious: cook tasty waffles and so much more with this Belgian style waffle maker. Fun and flexible, try waffle recipes that go from basic to gourmet.
Sleek style: this Premium Stainless Steel waffle baker is not only easy to clean but also looks great in any kitchen.
Eliminate guesswork: power and preheat lights on top of waffle maker show when power is on and when it's hot and ready for batter.
Easy to store: the lid locks for compact, upright storage of waffle maker in a cupboard or pantry.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,764 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
